meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring thicknesses and internal or external diameters.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used calipers to measure the thickness of the metal sheet.
meanings.sent2: The scientist carefully used the calipers to measure the diameter of the tiny cell.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly grabbed the calipers thinking they were tongs to pick up the hot pan.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like calipers, always accurately assessing people's true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The calipers clicked shut around the pipe, giving a satisfying confirmation of its size.

meanings.definition: A pair of compasses with curved legs for measuring the diameter or thickness of bodies.
meanings.sent1: The artist used calipers to measure the diameter of the circle she was drawing.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter relied on his calipers to ensure the thickness of the wood was consistent.
meanings.sent3: The calipers danced across the paper, leaving a trail of precise measurements behind.
meanings.sent4: His words were like calipers, always probing and measuring the impact of his statements.
meanings.sent5: The calipers gently encircled the delicate flower, careful not to damage its petals.
